articles.title: India COVID Stats
articles.contents:
h1{ color: red; font-size: 50px; } h2{ color: grey; font-size: 20px; } thead { background-color: #006DAE; color: white; } Data Description The Blog is using the data collected by ourworldindata.org and stored and updated timely in their github repo here. The team of “Our World in Data” has further collected this data from various sources such as: Confirmed Cases: This data comes from the COVID-19 Data Repository by the Center for Systems Science and Engineering (CSSE) at Johns Hopkins University (JHU). Hospitalizations and intensive care unit (ICU) admissions: Our data comes from the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) for a select number of European countries; and government sources for the United Kingdom, the United States, Canada, Israel, Algeria, and Switzerland. Testing for COVID-19: This data is collected by the Our World in Data team from official reports; you can find further details in our post on COVID-19 testing, including our checklist of questions to understand testing data, information on geographical and temporal coverage, and detailed country-by-country source information. The testing dataset is updated around twice a week. Vaccinations against COVID-19: This data is collected by the Our World in Data team from official reports. Other variables: This data is collected from a variety of sources (United Nations, World Bank, Global Burden of Disease, Blavatnik School of Government, etc.). More information is available in the codebook. The data is available in csv, xlsx, and json format. I will be working on csv format for this blog post. The main dataset is of dimensions 112442, 62, whereas that of India alone is 576, 62. NOTE: The data is upto date 2021-08-27. Analysis & Findings What are the top 5 days with maximum covid cases reported Table 1: Top 5 days with max no of covid cases Date Total_Cases New_Cases New_Tests Total_Tests Perc_New_Cases 2021-05-06 21491598 414188 1923131 296775209 21.54 2021-05-05 21077410 412431 1541299 294852078 26.76 2021-05-08 22296081 403405 1808344 300410043 22.31 2021-04-30 19164969 401993 1920107 286392086 20.94 2021-05-07 21892676 401078 1826490 298601699 21.96 Table 2: Top 5 days with max percetage of new covid cases Date Total_Cases New_Cases New_Tests Total_Tests Perc_New_Cases 2021-05-05 21077410 412431 1541299 294852078 26.76 2021-05-03 20282833 357316 1504698 291647037 23.75 2020-03-24 536 37 157 20864 23.57 2021-04-26 17636186 323023 1402367 279321177 23.03 2021-05-04 20664979 382146 1663742 293310779 22.97 The table 1 & 2 above tells us that: 6th May,2021 reported maximum new covid cases. 5th May,2021 had a more percentage of new cases reported w.r.t new tests done. What are top 5 days with maximum covid vaccinations done, also what is the % of 1st and 2nd dose? Table 3: Top 5 days with max no of vaccinations done Date Total_Cases Total_Doses new_vaccinations First_Dose Second_Dose 2021-07-08 30752950 368991222 10920459 68.62 31.38 2021-08-25 32558530 597923238 9191734 70.29 29.71 2021-06-21 29977861 283313942 9027343 90.87 9.13 2021-07-03 30545433 344300590 8628796 68.29 31.71 2021-06-26 30233183 314841384 8179856 84.27 15.73 Table 4: Top 5 days with max no of !st dose given Date Total_Cases Total_Doses new_vaccinations First_Dose Second_Dose 2021-01-16 10557985 191181 191181 100 NA 2021-01-17 10571773 224301 33120 100 NA 2021-01-18 10581823 454049 229748 100 NA 2021-01-19 10595639 674835 220786 100 NA 2021-01-20 10610883 806484 131649 100 NA Table 5: Top 5 days with max no of 2nd dose given Date Total_Cases Total_Doses new_vaccinations First_Dose Second_Dose 2021-02-25 11063491 13067047 700414 45.87 54.13 2021-05-08 22296081 167493857 2303857 46.52 53.48 2021-05-07 21892676 165190000 2586397 47.79 52.21 2021-05-10 22992517 171098918 2794050 47.86 52.14 2021-02-27 11096731 14242547 485607 48.56 51.44 The above tables 3,4 & 5 clearly showcases that: On 8th July,2021, maximum jabs of covid vaccines were given with mostly being that of 1st dose. Table 4 seems to be pretty obvious with its stats that during the the start of vaccination drive, everyone will get 1st dose only. Table 5 is more informative as it tells you about those days on which more than 50% of vaccinations done was of 2nd dose. Figure 1: Trend of total cases in a month each year The above graph depicts following points: In 2020, the increase in covid cases was pretty much steady and saw a gradual increase after May and reached to it’s peak in September with a total of 2621418 alone in this month. The above point seems to be pretty true also as India was in full lockdown till the end of May,2020, after which we only see a gradual increase in cases. In 2021, cases started increasing after February, but saw a shocking rise after the March (in-time, when the 2nd wave of covid kicked in) and reach to it’s all time high of 9010075 alone in May, after which it again dropped drastically to almost same to it’s total in February.
